title: Hosea Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Hosea chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Hosea Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Hosea Chapter 9.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:1, why should Israel not rejoice as other people do?
options: Because they have gone a whoring from their God
Because they are in exile
Because they have lost their harvest
Because the enemies have defeated them
questions.correctAnswer: Because they have gone a whoring from their God
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:1 says Israel should not rejoice because they have gone a whoring from their God.

questions.question: What will not feed them according to Hosea 9:2?
options: The floor and the winepress
The mountains and the rivers
The fields and the trees
The livestock and the fish
questions.correctAnswer: The floor and the winepress
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:2 states that the floor and the winepress shall not feed them.

questions.question: Where shall Ephraim return to, as stated in Hosea 9:3?
options: Egypt
Babylon
Assyria
Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:3 says Ephraim shall return to Egypt.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:4, what will their sacrifices be unto them?
options: As the bread of mourners
As sweet incense
As a pleasing aroma
As burnt offerings
questions.correctAnswer: As the bread of mourners
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:4 describes their sacrifices as the bread of mourners.

questions.question: What question is asked in Hosea 9:5 regarding the day of the feast of the LORD?
options: What will ye do in the solemn day?
Where will ye go for the feast?
Who will lead the offerings?
How will ye prepare the sacrifices?
questions.correctAnswer: What will ye do in the solemn day?
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:5 asks what they will do in the solemn day and in the day of the feast of the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 9:6 states that Memphis shall bury the people of Israel.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:6 says Memphis shall bury them.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:7, what are the prophet and the spiritual man called because of Israel's iniquity?
options: Fool and mad
Wise and just
Faithful and true
Strong and courageous
questions.correctAnswer: Fool and mad
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:7 states the prophet is a fool and the spiritual man is mad due to the multitude of iniquity.

questions.question: Who does Hosea say the watchman of Ephraim was with, according to Hosea 9:8?
options: God
The king
The people
The priests
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:8 says the watchman of Ephraim was with God.

questions.question: What comparison is made about Israel in Hosea 9:10?
options: Like grapes in the wilderness
Like sheep without a shepherd
Like birds in a cage
Like trees in a forest
questions.correctAnswer: Like grapes in the wilderness
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:10 compares Israel to grapes in the wilderness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Hosea 9:11: 'As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a _______, from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.'
options: bird
cloud
wind
shadow
questions.correctAnswer: bird
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:11 says Ephraim's glory shall fly away like a bird.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:12, what will God do even if they bring up their children?
options: Bereave them so there shall not be a man left
Bless them with many descendants
Protect them from enemies
Make them rulers over nations
questions.correctAnswer: Bereave them so there shall not be a man left
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:12 says God will bereave them so no man is left.

questions.question: What does Hosea 9:13 say about Ephraim's children?
options: They will be brought forth to the murderer
They will inherit the land
They will prosper and multiply
They will be priests and prophets
questions.correctAnswer: They will be brought forth to the murderer
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:13 states Ephraim will bring forth his children to the murderer.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 9:14 asks the LORD to give Ephraim a fruitful womb and abundant milk.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:14 asks for a miscarrying womb and dry breasts, the opposite of fruitfulness.

questions.question: Where is all their wickedness according to Hosea 9:15?
options: Gilgal
Bethel
Jerusalem
Samaria
questions.correctAnswer: Gilgal
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:15 states all their wickedness is in Gilgal.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 9:17 says God will cast away Israel because they did not listen to Him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:17 states God will cast them away because they did not hearken unto Him.

medium.title: Hosea Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Hosea Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Hosea 9:1 teach us about faithfulness in our relationship with God?
options: God values steadfast love, not seeking rewards from Him
It is acceptable to seek rewards for our devotion
Joy is found in material blessings
Whoring from God is a sign of spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: God values steadfast love, not seeking rewards from Him
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:1 warns Israel against going whoring from God and loving a reward on every threshing floor, emphasizing faithfulness and sincere devotion rather than selfish gain. This aligns with principles in verses 1, 9, and 15 where unfaithfulness leads to punishment.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because their efforts in work seem unfruitful. What encouragement does Hosea 9:2 provide?
options: The Lord may withhold blessings if we turn from Him
Hard work always guarantees success
God rewards only those who prosper materially
Effort is irrelevant in spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord may withhold blessings if we turn from Him
questions.explanation: Verse 2 shows that the floor and winepress will not feed the people and new wine will fail if they are unfaithful. This teaches us that God's blessing depends on obedience and faithfulness (verses 1, 2, 15).

questions.question: Based on Hosea 9:3, what is a consequence of turning away from God in terms of spiritual and physical security?
options: They shall not dwell in the Lord's land and will experience exile
They will receive abundant blessings in their land
Their enemies will be defeated by God
God will provide more children for them
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not dwell in the Lord's land and will experience exile
questions.explanation: Verse 3 indicates that Israel will be driven from the land and Ephraim will return to Egypt, eating unclean things in Assyria, symbolizing exile and loss of God's protection (verses 3, 12, 17).

questions.question: How does Hosea 9:4 warn us about the importance of pure motives in worship?
options: Sacrifices without a pure heart are like polluted bread
The quantity of offerings is most important
God accepts all sacrifices regardless of intent
Worship is not necessary for God's favor
questions.correctAnswer: Sacrifices without a pure heart are like polluted bread
questions.explanation: Verse 4 teaches that sacrifices offered with wrong motives make the worshipers polluted; true worship requires sincerity and purity (verses 4, 7, 15).

questions.question: What question in Hosea 9:5 prompts us to reflect on our spiritual preparedness during times of worship and fellowship?
options: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
How can we increase our offerings to God?
When will the enemies be destroyed?
Where can we find material blessings?
questions.correctAnswer: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Verse 5 asks how Israel will act on the LORD's feast days, encouraging self-examination about spiritual readiness and genuine worship (verses 5, 4, 7).

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:6, what is the outcome for those who reject God’s ways in terms of legacy and rest?
options: They will be gathered to destruction and their pleasant places overtaken by nettles
They will be honored with lasting peace
Their wealth will increase indefinitely
They will find refuge among the nations
questions.correctAnswer: They will be gathered to destruction and their pleasant places overtaken by nettles
questions.explanation: Verse 6 describes destruction and loss of comfort for Israel, highlighting the consequences of rejecting God, including loss of peace and inheritance (verses 6, 15, 17).

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 9:7 suggests that prophets and spiritual leaders may be rejected or appear foolish because of Israel’s sin.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 7 describes the prophet as a fool and the spiritual man as mad because of Israel’s great iniquity, showing how sin can lead to rejection of godly guidance.

questions.question: How does Hosea 9:8 warn about false prophecy and its effect on the people’s relationship with God?
options: The prophet is a snare and causes hatred in God's house
All prophets speak God's perfect truth
Prophets always bring peace and blessing
False prophecy is harmless to the church
questions.correctAnswer: The prophet is a snare and causes hatred in God's house
questions.explanation: Verse 8 warns that false prophets ensnare the people and cause division and hatred, undermining true worship and fellowship (verses 7, 8, 15).

questions.question: What lesson about perseverance through trials can we learn from Hosea 9:9 regarding Israel's corruption?
options: God remembers and visits sins but calls for repentance
Sin has no consequences
God ignores repeated failures
Corruption leads to immediate blessing
questions.correctAnswer: God remembers and visits sins but calls for repentance
questions.explanation: Verse 9 shows God’s awareness of Israel’s deep corruption and that He will bring consequences, encouraging believers to repent and persevere (verses 9, 15, 17).

questions.question: A parent is struggling with spiritual discipline in family life. How does Hosea 9:10 illustrate the importance of early faithfulness?
options: Like first fruits, early faithfulness is precious but turning to sin leads to shame
Faithfulness is only important in adulthood
Children should be left to choose their own paths without guidance
Sin in youth is easily overlooked by God
questions.correctAnswer: Like first fruits, early faithfulness is precious but turning to sin leads to shame
questions.explanation: Verse 10 compares Israel to grapes in the wilderness and the first fig stripe, showing the value of early faithfulness, but warns about turning to sin leading to shame (verses 10, 1, 9).

questions.question: How does Hosea 9:11 teach about the fragility of family blessings when faith is lost?
options: Ephraim’s glory will fly away even from conception, showing lost blessings
Family blessings are guaranteed regardless of faith
Children will always bring glory to their parents
Faith has no impact on family life
questions.correctAnswer: Ephraim’s glory will fly away even from conception, showing lost blessings
questions.explanation: Verse 11 depicts how Ephraim’s glory departs from birth and conception, emphasizing that faithlessness affects family legacy and blessings (verses 11, 12, 16).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hosea 9:12 says, 'Though they bring up their children, yet will I ______ them, that there shall not be a man left.'
options: bereave
bless
protect
reward
questions.correctAnswer: bereave
questions.explanation: Verse 12 states God will 'bereave' them despite their efforts, illustrating consequences of unfaithfulness even in family life.

questions.question: What warning does Hosea 9:13 give about the dangers within seemingly pleasant situations?
options: Ephraim, though well planted, will bring children to the murderer
Pleasant places guarantee safety
Comfort ensures spiritual success
Ephraim will prosper without trouble
questions.correctAnswer: Ephraim, though well planted, will bring children to the murderer
questions.explanation: Verse 13 warns that despite Ephraim’s favorable position, they will produce harmful outcomes, teaching vigilance in spiritual and family life (verses 13, 15, 16).

questions.question: How does Hosea 9:14 illustrate God’s judgment as a call to repentance in the context of family and blessing?
options: God asks to give a miscarrying womb and dry breasts to cut off fruitfulness
God always grants abundant children regardless of sin
Judgment is unrelated to family life
God rewards sin with prosperity
questions.correctAnswer: God asks to give a miscarrying womb and dry breasts to cut off fruitfulness
questions.explanation: Verse 14 displays God’s desire to remove fruitfulness from the sinful, urging repentance to restore blessing in family life (verses 14, 12, 16).

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 9:15 teaches that God will continue to love and accept those who persist in wickedness.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states God hated them for their wickedness and will drive them out of His house, showing the seriousness of persistent sin (verses 15, 17).

hard.title: Hosea Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Hosea Chapter 9.

questions.question: In Hosea 9:1, Israel is warned against rejoicing like other peoples because they have committed what sin against God?
options: Going a whoring from their God
Building idols from silver and gold
Refusing to offer sacrifices
Ignoring the Sabbath day
questions.correctAnswer: Going a whoring from their God
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:1 explicitly states that Israel has 'gone a whoring from thy God,' which is the reason they should not rejoice like other peoples.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:3, where will Ephraim return to, symbolizing exile and loss of blessing?
options: Egypt
Babylon
Assyria
Philistia
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:3 states, 'Ephraim shall return to Egypt,' indicating a reversal to a place of bondage and exile as a consequence of their sins.

questions.question: In Hosea 9:4, their sacrifices are compared to what kind of bread, indicating impurity and mourning?
options: Bread of mourners
Bread of the firstfruits
Bread of the covenant
Bread of gladness
questions.correctAnswer: Bread of mourners
questions.explanation: Verse 4 likens their sacrifices to 'the bread of mourners,' emphasizing that their offerings will not be pleasing but rather polluted and sorrowful.

questions.question: What question does Hosea 9:5 ask that highlights the futility of Israel's religious festivals after their judgment?
options: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
Who will lead us in the new song?
When shall the temple be rebuilt?
Where is the ark of the covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: What will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Verse 5 poses this question to emphasize the loss of meaning and efficacy in Israel's religious observances due to their sin.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 9:6 predicts that Egypt, specifically Memphis, will bury the people of Israel after their destruction.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:6 says, 'Egypt shall gather them up, Memphis shall bury them,' symbolizing exile and death in a foreign land.

questions.question: How does Hosea 9:7 describe the prophet and spiritual man in Israel, and what is the reason given?
options: The prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, due to the multitude of iniquity and hatred
The prophet is wise, the spiritual man is humble, because of their faithfulness
The prophet is silent, the spiritual man is joyful, due to God’s mercy
The prophet is strong, the spiritual man is bold, because of divine inspiration
questions.correctAnswer: The prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is mad, due to the multitude of iniquity and hatred
questions.explanation: Verse 7 states the prophet and spiritual man are considered foolish or mad because of Israel’s great sin and hatred.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Hosea 9:8 where the prophet is described as 'a snare of a fowler' in all his ways?
options: Metaphor
Simile
Alliteration
Hyperbole
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: The phrase 'a snare of a fowler' is a metaphor illustrating how the prophet entraps or misleads others.

questions.question: Hosea 9:9 compares Israel's corruption to which infamous biblical location known for wickedness?
options: Gibeah
Sodom
Jericho
Nineveh
questions.correctAnswer: Gibeah
questions.explanation: Verse 9 references 'the days of Gibeah,' a time noted for moral corruption and violence in Judges, highlighting Israel’s deep sin.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hosea 9:10 uses the imagery of Israel as _____ in the wilderness and their fathers as the first ripe fig on the fig tree.
options: grapes
olives
wheat
pomegranates
questions.correctAnswer: grapes
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:10 says, 'I found Israel like grapes in the wilderness,' symbolizing initial promise spoiled by idolatry.

questions.question: What does Hosea 9:11 prophesy about Ephraim's glory in relation to birth and conception?
options: It shall fly away like a bird
It shall grow strong and mighty
It shall be established forever
It shall be like the morning sun
questions.correctAnswer: It shall fly away like a bird
questions.explanation: Verse 11 predicts the loss of Ephraim’s glory 'from the birth, and from the womb, and from the conception,' likening it to a bird flying away.

questions.question: What judgment is requested in Hosea 9:14 for Israel, symbolizing barrenness and loss of nurture?
options: A miscarrying womb and dry breasts
Plagues of locusts and famine
Destruction of cities and fields
Exile to the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: A miscarrying womb and dry breasts
questions.explanation: Verse 14 petitions God to give Israel 'a miscarrying womb and dry breasts,' symbolizing judgment by barrenness.

questions.question: In Hosea 9:15, what location is associated with all Israel's wickedness and the reason God hates them there?
options: Gilgal
Bethel
Jerusalem
Shiloh
questions.correctAnswer: Gilgal
questions.explanation: Verse 15 states, 'All their wickedness is in Gilgal: for there I hated them,' identifying Gilgal as the center of their sin.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 9:16 says Ephraim will be fruitful and multiply despite being smitten and dried up.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:16 states Ephraim is smitten and their root is dried up; they shall bear no fruit, and even the beloved fruit of their womb will be slain.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:17, why will God cast Israel away and what will be their fate?
options: Because they did not hearken unto Him; they shall be wanderers among the nations
Because they worshipped other gods; they shall be destroyed utterly
Because they refused sacrifices; they shall be enslaved in their land
Because they ignored the prophets; they shall be restored quickly
questions.correctAnswer: Because they did not hearken unto Him; they shall be wanderers among the nations
questions.explanation: Verse 17 explains God will cast them away because they did not listen, resulting in them wandering among the nations.

questions.question: How does the theme of barrenness in Hosea 9:14 connect typologically to the New Testament concept of spiritual fruitfulness?
options: Physical barrenness symbolizes spiritual barrenness without Christ’s salvation
Barrenness indicates a future restoration of Israel
It represents a call to increase offspring in faith
It foreshadows the birth of the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: Physical barrenness symbolizes spiritual barrenness without Christ’s salvation
questions.explanation: The barrenness judgment in Hosea symbolizes the spiritual lifelessness of a people separated from God, a theme developed in the New Testament where fruitfulness is linked to abiding in Christ (John 15).

theological.title: Hosea Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Hosea Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:1, why should Israel not rejoice as other people do?
options: Because Israel has gone a whoring from their God
Because Israel has no harvest this year
Because Israel is at war
Because Israel has been blessed abundantly
questions.correctAnswer: Because Israel has gone a whoring from their God
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:1 states Israel should not rejoice because they have turned away from God, engaging in spiritual unfaithfulness. This theme of Israel's unfaithfulness is echoed in Jeremiah 3:6-10, Ezekiel 16:15-22, 2 Timothy 3:13, and Revelation 2:20 where God's people are warned against idolatry and spiritual adultery.

questions.question: What consequence does Hosea 9:3 describe for Ephraim?
options: They shall not dwell in the LORD's land and shall return to Egypt
They will prosper and multiply in the land
They will be given new vineyards
They will be exalted among the nations
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not dwell in the LORD's land and shall return to Egypt
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:3 declares that Ephraim will be exiled and will return to Egypt, signifying judgment and loss of their inheritance. This exile is consistent with themes in Deuteronomy 28:64, Jeremiah 16:15, Ezekiel 37:11, and Acts 7:6, where God's people face exile due to disobedience.

questions.question: In Hosea 9:4, what is said about the sacrifices and offerings of Israel?
options: Their sacrifices shall be as the bread of mourners and will pollute those who eat of them
Their sacrifices will be accepted and pleasing to God
Their offerings will bring joy to the LORD
Their sacrifices will cleanse them from sin
questions.correctAnswer: Their sacrifices shall be as the bread of mourners and will pollute those who eat of them
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:4 explains that Israel's sacrifices are not accepted but bring pollution, symbolizing God's rejection due to their unfaithfulness. This theme is echoed in Isaiah 1:11-17, Amos 5:21-23, Matthew 15:8-9, and Hebrews 10:26-27, which emphasize God desires obedience rather than ritual without heart.

questions.question: What question does Hosea 9:5 pose concerning Israel's festivals?
options: What will ye do in the solemn day and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
When will the festivals be restored?
Who will lead the celebrations now?
Will the festivals bring prosperity?
questions.correctAnswer: What will ye do in the solemn day and in the day of the feast of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:5 questions the value of Israel’s festivals given their unfaithfulness, highlighting the futility of worship without repentance. This resonates with Micah 6:6-8, Psalm 50:8-15, Isaiah 58:1-7, and Matthew 23:23, which critique empty religious observance.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:6, what will happen to Israel because of destruction?
options: Egypt shall gather them up and Memphis shall bury them
They will be victorious over their enemies
They will find peace in their land
They will be restored to their former glory
questions.correctAnswer: Egypt shall gather them up and Memphis shall bury them
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:6 describes Israel’s fate as being gathered and buried in Egypt, symbolizing exile and death. This judgment motif is consistent with Lamentations 5:18, Ezekiel 31:14, Jeremiah 9:22, and Revelation 18:2, underscoring God’s judgment on unfaithfulness.

questions.question: What does Hosea 9:7 say about the prophet and the spiritual man among Israel?
options: The prophet is a fool and the spiritual man is mad because of iniquity
The prophet is wise and the spiritual man is strong
The prophet is honored and the spiritual man is respected
The prophet is silent and the spiritual man is absent
questions.correctAnswer: The prophet is a fool and the spiritual man is mad because of iniquity
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:7 reveals the discrediting of true spiritual leadership due to widespread sin, reflecting spiritual confusion. Similar themes appear in Jeremiah 23:9-11, Ezekiel 13:2-3, 2 Timothy 3:8, and 1 Corinthians 1:18-25, where godly voices are rejected amid unrighteousness.

questions.question: How does Hosea 9:8 describe the prophet's role in Ephraim?
options: The prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways
The prophet is a faithful watchman for God
The prophet brings peace to the house of God
The prophet leads Ephraim to righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: The prophet is a snare of a fowler in all his ways
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:8 portrays the prophet as a trap, misleading the people, which fits with Jeremiah 14:14, Ezekiel 22:28, 2 Peter 2:1, and Matthew 7:15, warning against false teachers who corrupt God's people.

questions.question: What historical analogy does Hosea 9:9 use to describe Israel's corruption?
options: As in the days of Gibeah
As in the days of Egypt
As in the days of Babylon
As in the days of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: As in the days of Gibeah
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:9 likens Israel’s sin to the wickedness during the days of Gibeah (Judges 19-21), illustrating deep moral decay. This analogy aligns with Romans 1:18-32, Jeremiah 2:13, Ezekiel 16:49, and 2 Timothy 3:13, describing persistent human depravity.

questions.question: What imagery does Hosea 9:10 use to describe Israel and their fathers before their fall?
options: Israel like grapes in the wilderness and fathers as the first ripe fig
Israel like a mighty oak and fathers as tall cedars
Israel like a roaring lion and fathers as fierce eagles
Israel like a flowing river and fathers as fertile soil
questions.correctAnswer: Israel like grapes in the wilderness and fathers as the first ripe fig
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:10 uses fruit imagery to express Israel's initial blessing and potential before falling into idolatry. This echoes Deuteronomy 32:32, Jeremiah 24:2-3, John 15:1-8, and Galatians 5:22-23 where fruitfulness symbolizes divine blessing and covenant faithfulness.

questions.question: What does Hosea 9:11 say will happen to Ephraim's glory?
options: Their glory shall fly away like a bird from the womb
Their glory shall be established forever
Their glory shall multiply like the stars
Their glory shall return in the last days
questions.correctAnswer: Their glory shall fly away like a bird from the womb
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:11 predicts the loss of Ephraim’s offspring and future glory, reflecting judgment on the covenant people. Similar themes appear in Psalm 37:25, Jeremiah 22:30, Malachi 4:6, and Luke 1:17 about the consequences of sin and hope for restoration.

questions.question: According to Hosea 9:12, what will God do even if Israel raises children?
options: He will bereave them so that there shall not be a man left
He will bless the children abundantly
He will protect the children from harm
He will multiply their descendants
questions.correctAnswer: He will bereave them so that there shall not be a man left
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:12 declares God's judgment will cause loss of descendants despite human effort. This aligns with Genesis 6:3, Isaiah 13:16, Jeremiah 5:9, and Hebrews 12:6 where God's discipline includes barrenness and loss for covenant unfaithfulness.

questions.question: What tragic outcome does Hosea 9:13 associate with Ephraim's children?
options: Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer
Ephraim’s children shall be kings and priests
Ephraim’s children shall inherit a peaceful land
Ephraim’s children shall be raised in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Ephraim shall bring forth his children to the murderer
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:13 foretells the death of Ephraim’s offspring, symbolizing judgment and loss. This is consistent with Exodus 12:29, Jeremiah 7:30, Ezekiel 9:6, and Matthew 2:16 where judgment leads to the death of the innocent as a consequence of sin.

questions.question: What does Hosea 9:14 petition God to give Israel?
options: A miscarrying womb and dry breasts
A land flowing with milk and honey
A renewed spirit and a joyful heart
Victory over their enemies
questions.correctAnswer: A miscarrying womb and dry breasts
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:14 asks God to give Israel barrenness as judgment for their sins. This judgment of fruitlessness is echoed in Genesis 30:1, 1 Samuel 1:5-6, Isaiah 54:1, and Romans 9:7-9, showing how barrenness can symbolize divine discipline.

questions.question: What is the significance of Gilgal in Hosea 9:15?
options: It is where all their wickedness is and where God hated them
It is a place of divine blessing and covenant renewal
It is the city where the temple was built
It is the site of Israel’s greatest victory
questions.correctAnswer: It is where all their wickedness is and where God hated them
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:15 highlights Gilgal as a center of Israel's persistent sin and God's rejection. This is consistent with Joshua 5:9, 2 Kings 2:1-2, Jeremiah 9:25, and Hosea 4:15 where Gilgal symbolizes apostasy and judgment.

questions.question: What does Hosea 9:16 say about Ephraim’s fruitfulness?
options: Their root is dried up and they shall bear no fruit
Their fruit shall be abundant and blessed
Their branches shall spread over the land
Their fruit shall be for the healing of the nations
questions.correctAnswer: Their root is dried up and they shall bear no fruit
questions.explanation: Hosea 9:16 states Ephraim will be fruitless due to divine judgment. This echoes Jeremiah 17:5-6, Isaiah 5:1-7, Matthew 7:17-20, and John 15:2 where fruitlessness symbolizes separation from God and judgment.
